story.text: Chemistry, Energy and GHG intensity, and Water intensity are examined across all the cradle-to-gate life cycle stages.

The Chemistry portion divides the cradle-to-gate life cycle (Figure 2) into two phases:  
Phase 1: Farm/wellhead to an intermediate stage 
Phase 2: The intermediate stage to the finished textile or component part
Land Use intensity focuses solely on the origin of the raw materials and does not consider land use elsewhere in the cradle-to-gate life cycle.
Physical Waste is covered from the raw material origin—farm, forest, or wellhead—to an intermediate stage of a fiber or polymer ready for further processing (for example, spun into a yarn).
Transportation of raw materials and intermediates are incorporated where applicable.
